message.entry: The number of inputs to the PTX code ({0,number,integer}) is NOT the same as the number of inputs in the C prototype ({1,number,integer}).
The specified block size ({0,number,integer}) was invalid for this device.
bool in C must be unsigned.
The specified grid size was invalid for this device.
The specified shared memory amount was invalid for this device.
Could not find .cu file corresponding to PTX file {0}.
Unable to parse declaration: {0}
An error occurred during PTX compilation.
Unable to read CUDA file {0}: No such file or directory.
This function only understands PTX version 1.4, but the module supplied indicates version {0}.\nNot checking prototype and number of args.
An invalid argument was supplied for argument {0,number,integer}.
The entry name argument must be a character vector.
Cannot read from file: {0}
Invalid size input to kernel GridSize. You must provide a vector of up to 3 positive integers. The maximum value in each dimension is: [{0}].
Input must be ''all''.
The first input to parallel.gpu.CUDAKernel must be the name of a file that contains PTX code or an array containing PTX code.
Kernel inputs must be numeric, logical, or {0}. Input argument {1,number,integer} was of type ''{2}''.
The kernel prototype specifies that argument {0,number,integer} must be a scalar input. The array supplied was not scalar.
This kernel is no longer valid.
The ''module'' argument must be a character vector.
Number of input arguments for this kernel is fixed at {0,number,integer}.
Number of output arguments for this kernel cannot exceed {0,number,integer}.
The C Prototype argument must be a character vector.
The shared memory size for a kernel must be a positive integer, and must not exceed the device''s limit on the amount of shared memory per block ({0} bytes).
Invalid size input to kernel ThreadBlockSize. You must provide a vector of up to 3 positive integers whose product is <= {0,number,integer}. The maximum value in each dimension is: [{1}].
Unable to parse variable declaration.
The matrix is too large for this operation.
An unexpected error occurred trying to launch a kernel. The CUDA error was:\n{0}
The kernel image is invalid. Be sure that the specified kernel was compiled using CUDA 3.2 or later.
The GPU has timed out. See www.mathworks.com/gputimeout for details about GPU timeouts and how to avoid them.
Found multiple matching entries in the PTX code. Matches found:\n{0}
No entries were found in the PTX file.
No entry point in the PTX code matches ''{0}''. The entry points in the PTX code are:\n{1}
Kernel no longer exists on the GPU.
No module with that handle.
Cannot have unsigned double or float.
An empty array (null pointer) was passed to the CUDA kernel. Attempting to access the elements of this array will cause an error on the GPU.
The GPU might have timed out. See www.mathworks.com/gputimeout for details about GPU timeouts and how to avoid them.

The complexity of the array supplied for argument {0,number,integer} does not match the kernel prototype. The kernel prototype specifies that the input must be an array of {1} data but the input supplied was an array of {2} data.
Expected pointer type for kernel argument {0,number,integer} but found ''{1}'' in the PTX.

Found invalid mapping for kernel argument {0,number,integer}. The PTX is not consistent with the prototype. The kernel prototype specifies {1} but the PTX expects ''{2}''. You might have specified the wrong PTX file, or it might need recompiling.

The type of the array supplied for argument {0,number,integer} does not match the kernel prototype. The kernel prototype specifies that the input must be an array of ''{1}'' data but the input supplied was an array of type ''{2}''.
When constructing a CUDAKernel with PTX code, a prototype must be specified.
The constant ''{0}'' was not found.
The data supplied is too big for constant ''{0}''.
Inputs to ''setConstantMemory'' must be supplied as name-value pairs.
The name of the device constant memory variable must be a character array.
Only full arrays are supported on the GPU.
Values to be set into device constant memory must be numeric.
Found more than one entry point in the PTX code. Possible names are:\n{0}
Unable to create GPU input of the correct type.
The PTX entry point name has not parsed to an equivalent C name.
